msContents.summary: On the front an account of food allowances paid as salary for one day to the employees of Apollonios' estate; the food assignments (sitometria) consisted of two different kind of wheat; on the back there is a list of expenditures for the last 7 days of an unnamed month: the amounts of money were paid to various employees for wages, supplies, and advances for travelling expenses

msItemStruct.note: 42 lines written along the fibers by a large, rough hand with additions and corrections

The back is written across the fibers with 26 lines by a smaller and more proficient hand with smudges and erasures; a large blank space is left underneath the text; at the bottom some figures appear by a third hand: the writing is inverted with respect to the remainder

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 8 (original no. 102) in Bell's inventory
